name: Cross-Body Shoulder Stretch
setup: Stand or sit tall with good posture
Extend right arm straight across chest at shoulder height
steps: Use left hand to gently pull right arm closer to chest
Keep right arm straight or slightly bent
Feel stretch in back of right shoulder and upper arm
Hold for prescribed time, breathing deeply
cues: Pull arm toward chest, not down
mistakes: Rotating torso instead of isolating shoulder
Pulling arm down instead of across
safety: Stop if you feel pinching in shoulder joint. Use gentle tension, no forcing. Avoid if you have recent shoulder injury.

progressions: Add gentle rotation away from stretched arm
Combine with neck stretch (look over opposite shoulder)

prescriptionHints.notes: Great for posterior shoulder and upper back. Essential after pressing or throwing movements.

joints.notes: Use gentle pressure. Stop if you feel joint pain or pinching.
